Articles.Content:
**Monkey Transfer Vehicle Update**

This is the new two - launch version using the four SRB XLS vehicle to put segments B and C into orbit and then the classic MLS vehicle to put this revised habitat section up.

![aSgcr8.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img910/3956/aSgcr8.jpg)

![6HwGSX.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img909/5614/6HwGSX.jpg)

![YIqQCQ.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img913/4586/YIqQCQ.jpg)

![Dj41JP.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img910/9426/Dj41JP.jpg)
My personal preference is a shorter docking hab area just behind the main white hab. It currently looks really long. But other than that, it looks great!

> 
> My personal preference is a shorter docking hab area just behind the main white hab. It currently looks really long. But other than that, it looks great!

I was thinking maybe if it were longer it could be spun for some G's

**Pre - Departure Selfies**

![TUj2VD.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img912/5148/TUj2VD.jpg)

![8FtyZn.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img905/5184/8FtyZn.jpg)

![hLi0b6.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img910/8347/hLi0b6.jpg)

What's the current difference between the NOS and Altair lander bodies? Personally I like the NOS model much better, and I think in this current CMES save, I'll be using it exclusively unless there's a real drawback to its use.
Just wanted to post my thanks, love this mod and looking forward to the update!

> 
> What's the current difference between the NOS and Altair lander bodies? Personally I like the NOS model much better, and I think in this current CMES save, I'll be using it exclusively unless there's a real drawback to its use.

I spoke with Chaka about this personally.

He said that, strictly speaking, he can not take credit for the mission scope of either lander, since Altair was designed by NASA and modeled by Bobcat, and NOS was designed by Boeing and modeled by NoOneSpecial. In other words, Altair is desgined for the Mun and has a structural capacity suited for that environment. The NOS lander has far greater structural loading capacity suited for Duna E, D, and L. Also it has nice snacks boxes, a wider platform and engines that are high from the ground to avoid kickup damage.

> 
> Just wanted to post my thanks' date=' love this mod and looking forward to the update![/quote']
> Thanks! Keep Exploring ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> I spoke with Chaka about this personally.
> He said that, strictly speaking, he can not take credit for the mission scope of either lander, since Altair was designed by NASA and modeled by Bobcat, and NOS was designed by Boeing and modeled by NoOneSpecial. In other words, Altair is desgined for the Mun and has a structural capacity suited for that environment. The NOS lander has far greater structural loading capacity suited for Duna E, D, and L. Also it has nice snacks boxes, a wider platform and engines that are high from the ground to avoid kickup damage.

I'm glad the great Chaka himself opined on my question. I'm going to stick with the NOS, like I said, for commonality in all lander stages, and those excellent snack storage boxes!

More pictures! Please note on the last picture, the weird error with the suit-rack prop floating a distance away from the craft is still around. This was a recently-downloaded instance of CMES

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/LgHp2)

I'm particularly proud of that light post for the landing site, made out of parts brought in containers with KAS/KIS. Makes the Landing site look used and busy!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-06T20:11:09Z" title="10/06/2015 08:11  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 6, 2015</time> by Budgie**

Chaka says that he really likes your Mun Base and that as long as the lander contains nice fuits then you have his complete support ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

![KdbvdU.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img661/7381/KdbvdU.jpg)

**Orion SPS Nozzle Expansion**

Increased ISP with expanded nozzle. Fits into standard Orion attachment fairing, and makes better use of available space.

![wzpZbC.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img911/300/wzpZbC.jpg)

![VIpDxW.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img910/928/VIpDxW.jpg)

Note rendezvous and docking testing with revised Duna Return to Orbit capsule.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-23T02:15:29Z" title="10/23/2015 02:15  AM" data-short="8 yr">October 23, 2015</time> by Mecripp2**

> 
> Looks like NASA still showing both lol

Look here [https://www.nasa.gov/press-release/nasa-completes-critical-design-review-for-space-launch-system](https://www.nasa.gov/press-release/nasa-completes-critical-design-review-for-space-launch-system)

Caption under the picture: "The SLS Program has completed its critical design review, and the program has concluded that the core stage of the rocket will remain orange along with the Launch Vehicle Stage Adapter, which is the natural color of the insulation that will cover those elements."

Which is a shame, I prefer the paint ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

> 
> Looks like NASA still showing both lol [http://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/14-229b.jpg](http://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/14-229b.jpg)

...Maybe...it represents the,first one for,testing?
Nope it's the same problem they had with the first shuttle. They painted the tank white but it was way too much unecessary weight, and one coat of paint doesn't look right.
So they waited until right before Halloween to reveal the orange paint scheme??

> 
> so they waited until right before halloween to reveal the orange paint scheme??

illuminati confirmed

Looks like Chaka is getting an orange Monkey Foam TM stage adapter as a Halloween gift.
